Victor.Action: Avoids interaction with Carlos because he is punished and cannot come down.
Is asleep and dazed in the sun, indicating low alertness and lack of immediate responsiveness.
Explains he cannot come down because he is punished, showing awareness of his limits and rules.
Refuses to go out to the pool because he fears punishment, showing awareness of consequences and self-control.
Decides to avoid being seen from above by quickly pushing Carlos down the block and carefully rounding the corner, demonstrating situational awareness and practical problem-solving.
Initially sits down and hesitates to join Carlos, showing lack of confidence and passivity in social situations.
Expresses frustration about his mother cutting his hair poorly but does not take action to resolve the issue, indicating some passivity or lack of assertiveness.
Despite hesitation, he ultimately chooses to go down and engage socially when motivated by the presence of girls, indicating some adaptability but also some susceptibility to peer pressure.
Expresses concern about leaving their own neighborhood, shows loyalty by saying 'if I go down you're goin' down with me.'
Interacts warmly with his brother and friend by giving a playful smack and banging on a store window to wave hello.
Looks watchfully and surveys the area carefully, indicating cautiousness but not explicitly warmth.
Disagrees with Carlos's negative statement and follows him despite concerns, showing cautious engagement.
Questions Carlos's decision and expresses hesitation about leaving their own neighborhood.
Makes a firm statement 'if I go down you're going down with me,' indicating loyalty and confidence in facing challenges together.
Carefully surveys the pool area and proceeds into the park cautiously, ensuring not to bump anyone, showing situational awareness and tact.
Stands carefully in the crowd, trying not to bump anyone.
Looks uncomfortable when left alone next to Amanda and Jenette.
Responds politely to Amanda's questioning, gives his name calmly.
Does not engage in aggressive or rude behavior, simply states he is with Carlos and moves away when asked.
Responds correctly to Carlos about Eddie's identity, showing understanding of social connections.
Stands uncomfortably next to Amanda and Jenette, appearing socially unsure.
Has a brief, somewhat awkward exchange with Amanda and does not assert himself.
Clearly states his name twice when asked, showing straightforward communication.
Decides to leave and go find Carlos without causing a scene, indicating sensible social awareness.
Plays with Carlos in the pool, engages in playful teasing by trying to dunk each other and making faces
Climbs out of the pool to go to the bathroom instead of urinating in the water as Carlos suggests
Quietly vows to beat Carlos, showing competitive spirit but also friendly rivalry
Continues antagonizing Carlos from a distance while Amanda waits behind him in line
Engages confidently in playful competition and taunts Carlos, showing determination to win.
Politely excuses himself to go to the bathroom instead of acting immaturely.
Responds casually and briefly to Amanda's greetings, showing neutral social engagement.
Allows Amanda to take his hand and follows her lead when she drags him away from Hector, tolerating her behavior without protest.
Watches Amanda urinate while trying to 'play it cool,' showing discomfort and lack of proactive supportive behavior.
Turns back and forth responding to Amanda's greetings with brief, confident replies.
Appears confused when Amanda complains about Hector following her.
Watches Amanda urinating while trying to play it cool, showing discomfort and lack of assertiveness.
Approaches Carlos and initiates a friendly conversation, leans on his shoulder while talking.
Presses Carlos about a girl he kissed, shows some impatience and threatens to punch him.
Approaches Carlos directly, initiates a conversation calmly, and tries to get information by referencing a mutual connection.
Gets somewhat frustrated and threatens to punch Carlos when Carlos is not cooperative.
Shares that Amanda lent him her mom's pills to save her life, showing concern and responsibility.
Walks away calmly after Carlos shrugs him off, showing tolerance and a non-confrontational attitude.
Declines to buy M-80s from Aaron, showing disinterest in trouble.
Waits awkwardly to speak to Jenette, showing patience in a social interaction.
Repeatedly tries to get information from Jenette about Amanda, despite her ignoring him.
Refuses to engage with Aaron's offer to buy M-80s, avoids unnecessary conflict or distraction.
Scans the buildings on the block, appearing alert and cautious.
Approaches Jenette awkwardly and repeatedly tries to get information, despite clear disinterest and avoidance from her.
Persists in questioning Jenette when she is clearly avoiding him, leading to ineffective communication.
Looks at Hector, then walks away down the block instead of escalating conflict.
Talks to himself about aggressive revenge with hostile language.
Looks at Hector after a threat then walks away instead of escalating the conflict.
Sits alone on the sidewalk and vents frustration to himself without taking constructive action.
Greets Chris and engages him in a friendly game of catch, follows him playfully.
Initiates a conversation with Chris and engages in a game of catch, quickly adapting and following Chris through an alley despite the 'No Trespassing' sign.
Approaches Jenette and sits down beside her quietly while she draws, showing willingness to be near her despite limited engagement.
Dismisses Jenette's questions about liking Amanda and relationship interest directly and briefly ('No', 'Not really'), showing aloofness and lack of encouragement.
Returns to sit beside Jenette after initially standing to leave, indicating some openness to her presence despite minimal verbal interaction.
Does not respond to Jentette's invitation to be her boyfriend, remaining silent and avoiding commitment or emotional connection.
Refuses Jenette's offer to get back at Hector, turning away.
Shows concern for Jenette by asking if she's alright.
Offers to do whatever Jenette wants.
Struggles to keep up with Aaron and Jenette, showing effort to stay involved.
Refuses to take revenge or escalate the situation despite provocation and peer pressure (says 'Nah' to Jenette's offer to get back at Hector).
Offers to do whatever Jenette wants when Aaron arrives, indicating willingness to help in the moment.
Struggles to keep up physically as they move toward confrontation (sneakers skid on cement).
Looks at Hector during confrontation but does not intervene or defend Hector, quietly confirms Hector touched Jenette.
Approaches Amanda and greets her in a friendly manner.
Complies with Aaron's call and turns back towards the action; verbally confirms he saw Hector touching Jenette, which supports Aaron's confrontation.
Initially tries to turn away from the conflict, showing hesitation or avoidance.
Engages Amanda by approaching her and initiating conversation, showing social confidence.
Came to see Amanda and sits down to talk with her.
Talks about multiple girlfriends casually; shows no sincerity or focus on meaningful connection.
